announcements.announcement:
The PHP development team announces the immediate availability of PHP 7.1.0. This release is the first point release in the 7.x series.
PHP 7.1.0 comes with numerous improvements and new features such as
- [Nullable types](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/nullable_types) - [Void return type](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/void_return_type) - [Iterable pseudo-type](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/iterable) - [Class constant visiblity modifiers](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/class_const_visibility) - [Square bracket syntax for `list()`](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/short_list_syntax) and [the ability to specify keys in `list()`](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/list_keys) - [Catching multiple exceptions types](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/multiple-catch) - [Many more features and changes…](https://wiki.php.net/rfc#php_71)
The [migration guide](http://php.net/manual/en/migration71.php) is available in the PHP Manual. Please consult it for the detailed list of new features and backward incompatible changes.
Many thanks to all the contributors and supporters!
